intro: Echinopsilon reuterianus, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic to both humans and animals, containing cardiac glycosides. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, with a rough texture. Echinopsilon reuterianus is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
